body.name: Mueller RapidTherm Portable Induction Cooktop Hot Plate Countertop Burner 1800W, 8 Temp Levels, Timer, Auto-Shut-Off, Touch Panel, LED Display, Auto Pot Detection, Child Safety Lock, 4 Preset Programs

Or fastest pickup Friday, February 16. Order within 2 hrs 49 mins
features: Practical and Portable: The highly versatile RapidTherm Induction Cooktop boasts 1800W of cooking power, and many smart features at your fingertips. ETL approved and operating at standard 120V, the lightweight electric cooktop is easy to handle and store and is the ideal size for RV’s, small apartments or anywhere you need an extra cooktop. With no hot coils or open flames, it’s the hassle-free way to create sumptuous dishes.

Energy-Friendly: The powerful induction burner only heats the diameter of the pan, so no energy is wasted. Plus heat is instant and evenly distributed, cooking your food 50% faster than conventional gas or electric cooktops. Suitable for induction-ready cookware with flat ferrous bases (test with a magnet) such as cast iron, enameled steel, or magnetic stainless steel with base diameter between 4.8”-10.2”.

Digital Control Panel: Swiftly choose between 4 preset programs: Hot Pot, Slow Cook, Boil and Keep Warm that will automatically switch off after cooking. Or, for maximum flexibility, make use of the 8 power levels (200-1800 Watts), wide temperature range (140-460°F), and handy extra-long 4 hour digital timer. Includes durable blade fan for overheat protection.

Safe And Easy To Use: In order to use this and any other induction stove, you need to use cookware with a magnetic bottom. The auto-pan detection will shut the unit off automatically after 60 seconds if no cookware, or the incorrect cookware is detected. When you need to step away for a minute, use the Pause feature to temporarily stop cooking while locking in your cooking settings. When you’re all done, simply wipe with a damp cloth.

Superior Quality With Mueller - We are here to offer you only the best quality products designed to make your life easier. If you need any help, please feel free to contact us. Our unparalleled 24/7 live telephone customer support is ready and waiting to assist with anything you need!
body.description: 4 Preset Cooking Modes (Hot Pot, Slow Cook, Boil, and Keep Warm) 8 Power Levels (200W-1800W) 8 Temperature Levels (140°F-460°F) Long Timer (1 – 240 Minutes) Auto Turn Off Automatic Pan Detection Child Safety Lock Overheat Protection

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Mueller RapidTherm Induction Burner – Your Portable Electric Stove Solution Whether you want to go camping, live in a small studio apartment and are lacking space, or you simply want to cook outdoors for a garden party, this burner is the ideal choice! It is convenient, lightweight, stylish, and most importantly – it does the job perfectly! With rapid heating and efficient power options, it will meet your daily needs at little cost and with little time spent cleaning. Cook smart with the Mueller Portable Induction Cooktop!

Happiness is Homemade! Mueller strives to enrich the home with intuitive products for everyday use. Designed and engineered based on consumer insights, Mueller’s wide range of products sets the standard in quality, functionality, and timeless design, with exceptional service. 4 Preset Cooking Modes (Hot Pot, Slow Cook, Boil, and Keep Warm) 8 Power Levels (200W-1800W) 8 Temperature Levels (140°F-460°F) Long Timer (1 – 240 Minutes) Auto Turn Off Automatic Pan Detection Child Safety Lock Overheat Protection

Our RapidTherm Cooktop is Fast Because our induction hot plates respond rapidly compared to conventional cooktops, you can decrease your cooking time by up to 50% - just like that, cooking will no longer be a time-consuming chore. Safer for Kids and Pets With no heating element or open flame, the induction burner does not get as hot as regular electric burners, and it cools down within minutes, making burns and incidents much less likely to happen! Rarely Make a Mess If you love to cook, but hate to clean, you will be a happy camper! Cleaning up is a piece of cake – food rarely sticks, as the stove remains relatively cool, and all it needs is a wipe down. Adds Class to Any Kitchen There is no doubt that the flat glass-based induction cooktop is an attractive addition to any kitchen. They can also be great conversation starters at your indoor and outdoor parties!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast boiling, portable, great induction heat for the $
reviews.reviewText: We've used this every day for the past few months. It boils water faster than our microwave, and much faster than our gas stove. We use a round cast iron skillet for pancakes, a camping stainless steel cup for individual water heating (even though it's not super magnetic- it still works with induction), a regular size pressure cooker, and a very large 22qt stock pot for most of our cooking. So far the unit works great and heats quickly and efficiently. It hums and has a fan when it's on, but is quieter than our microwave. One of the larger skillets or pots got off center once and the plastic melted slightly on the side, but the damage was barely visible and didn't affect the function. On the lower settings the unit will switch on and off periodically to adjust the temperature. This works fine with thicker pans, but with thin pans frying items cycle repeatedly between a strong sizzle then stop- it would be nice if it had a more constant lower power setting. Overall we are very happy with having an induction heater for much less than a full stove. Controls are easy to use once you learn which buttons mean what. One setting stays on longer than the other, and the +/- allows adjustment of the temp. Easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, use it all the time at home and when RV camping
reviews.reviewText: This was a great purchase and a good bargain. Had it 10 months so far with no issues. At home we use it instead of the gas stove for quick boiling and cooking without fumes, with no need to run the exhaust fan. We also took it on a cross country RV trip this summer (very portable) and used it whenever we had electric hookups (cooks faster than the propane stove). It seems to draw less current than regular electric cooktops as it uses electromagnets instead of just a heat coil; it never overloaded a circuit yet in our old house or in the RV. After use it cools down quickly and can be put away in about a minute after the fan turns off. The glass top is easy to clean, and the controls are easy to use. It obviously does only work with induction-compatible pans (if a magnet sticks to the pan bottom it should work), but most of the pans I already had were compatible. Works best when the pan bottom fits within the circles as that's where the heat is generated.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works exceptionally well
reviews.reviewText: Our kitchen was being remodeled last summer and we needed a substitute for our range. What I love about this is it is very safe. Any pan you have that a magnet will stick to works on this plate. Even though it’s black, the display is large and well lit. I even used it to boil water in my bedroom when I had Covid and was congested bevause my humidifier always gets the floor wet. This does nothing of the kind. It doesn’t heat up the tabletop nor the floor. It’s very well made. If you want to cook outside because you’re frying I think it’s great for that too. And it fits in a drawer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Update Oct 2023: Good product and great customer support
reviews.reviewText: Update on Oct 29, 2023: I contacted the manufacturer’s customer support and after 4 emails back and forth on the same day they initiated a replacement of the product. It arrived in 3 days and I’ve used if 3 or 4 times since.It works well, I like that it heats up very quickly, much quicker than the gas stovetop. One downside is it has limited temperature controls, but I’ve learnt how to manage them.Initial review: I used it probably 8 times, 15-20 minutes each time and then it died. It started to smell like burnt electronic circuitry and stopped working.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much nicer than expected
reviews.reviewText: This unit was larger but nicer than expected. It looks really clean with its design, works incredibly well and seems to be energy efficient. We don't have many pots and pans to use with it but wanted to test the induction system prior to buying a stove; highly recommend people do that as the learning curve is there for induction! Water boils fast, the safety features work perfectly and the unit is great. Nice unit especially for the price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks well and fast.
reviews.reviewText: Works great as long as you have magnetic induction bottom cookware. Really fast, easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, use it almost everyday
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this to use for camping. Heats up fast, easy to clean, and packs small. It was so convenient I use it nearly everyday to warm up water for making pour overs. Great product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works good but best for 7 inch skillets
reviews.reviewText: I use an 11 in cast iron skillet and was hoping this would work for frying bacon or fish outside on my patio to keep from smelling up my house and splattering up my kitchen. Unfortunately the hot spot on this is only about 6-7 inches, so things in the middle burn and stuff around the edges does not cook, even on cast iron. A strip o0f bacon will burn in the middle and the ends will still be undercooked. Furthermore, the hot skillet extends dangerously close to the plastic control panel causing some discoloration and a crack on the corner. I'm going to start looking for a larger one that will have a larger hot spot. That said, it has been over a year that I have been using this and it has held up.
This is one of the best I’ve had. Heats up and boils so quick.
